alert.note: Alert for Augusta; Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Eastern Highland; Rockingham; Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 11:28AM EDT until March 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations around 1 to 3 inches, generally for elevation above 1,500 feet. A glaze of ice up to one tenth of an inch from freezing rain is expected along the ridges above 2,000 feet. * WHERE...Portions of central and western Virginia and eastern West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Monday. Snow through this afternoon may change to freezing rain at times late this afternoon and evening on the ridges. Lower elevations will change to rain and drizzle. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Augusta; Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Eastern Highland; Rockingham; Western Highland
